definition: meaning (of foreign expression)/translation of the meaning (as opposed to literal translation 直譯|直译)/paraphrase/free translation
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: You can also practise scanning for paraphrases of key words.
sentences.chinese: 還可以通過意譯重述關鍵詞進行關鍵詞轉換練習。

sentences.english: INTRODUCTION People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人們經常討論直譯和意譯。

sentences.english: People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人們經常討論直譯和意譯。

sentences.english: As a result of the cultural difference, the transliteration definitely will bring the misregistration.
sentences.chinese: 但是由於文化的差異，意譯必然會帶來誤讀。

definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
phonetic component of a Chinese character
